406590-d-03-06-06-WC.Narrative: A45391-06 WAS COMING OFF THE IHB CONNECTION ONTO THE CN MAIN LINE WHEN A 3 INCH PIECE OF RAIL BROKEUNDER THE 39TH CAR CAUSING THE CAR TO DERAIL.  THE TRAIN CONTINUED NORTH 2 CAR LENGTHS WITH THE DERAILED TRUCK DIGGING INTO THE ROADBED BEFORE THE DRAWBAR FAILED, CAUSING THE TRAIN TO GO INTO EMERGENCY.  WHEN THE DRAWBAR BROKE DOWX 71638 AND UTLX 220853 ROLLED ONTO THEIR SIDES.  THE DRAWBAR WAS NOTA FACTOR IN CAUSING THE DERAILMENT.  THE INITIAL POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS ON WC TRACKS AND THAT IS WHERE THE TRACK FAILURE OCCURRED.  WHEN THE TRAIN DERAILED, IT ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO METRA/NIRC TRACKSAMOUNTING TO $46,000.
406590-d-03-06-06-WC.Maintenance Parent Railroad Company Name: NORTHEAST ILLINOIS REGIONAL COMMUTER RAIL CORP. -- METRA

D0290306-d-03-19-06-WATX.Narrative: CREW WAS SHOVING 7 LOADED GONDOLAS TOWARD TRACK #34, THE 7 LOADED CARS MADE IT OVER THE SWITCH WITHOUT INCIDENT HOWEVER THE R-4 WHEEL OF THE LOCOMOTIVE CONTACTED THE SWITCH POINT APPROXIMATELY 1 INCHPAST THE BEGINNING OF THE POINT CAUSING A BREAK OF APPROXIMATELY 1 1/2 INCHES IN LENGTH ALLOWING THEFLANGE OF THE R-4 WHEEL TO SLIP BEHIND THE POINT WHICH CAUSED THE R-4 WHEEL TO FOLLOW THE RAIL TOWARD THE LEAD WHILE THE R-3 WHEEL FOLLOWED THE SWITCH POINT TOWARD TRACK #34 THIS CAUSING THE DERAILMENT.  THE SWITCH POINT APPEARED TO FIT PROPERLY WITHOUT LOAD ON THE TRACK AND THE TIE CONDITION WAS DECENT.  GUAGE WAS 57 INCHES AND THE R-4 WHEEL FLANGE MEASURED 1 1/6 INCHES EVEN THOUGH IT APPEARED TO BE SHARP TO THE NAKED EYE.  THE MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED WITHIN 20 FEET OF THE DERAILMENT HOWEVER DUETO THE TRUCKS TURNING THE LOCOMOTIVE WHEELS WERE GOUGED CAUSING THE NEED FOR REPLACEMENT.

2006051-d-03-31-06-DME.Narrative: CONDUCTOR WAS ROLLING THE RELEASE AS THE TRAIN WAS COMING OUT THE WEST END OF THE LAMBERTON ELEVATORTRACK.  AS THE 80-84TH CAR CAME UP TO THE SWITCH, HE SAW SPARKS AND TOLD THE ENGINEER "THAT WILL DO" MULTIPLE TIMES.  FIVE CARS WERE DERAILED.  CREW WAS NOT DRUG/ALCOHOL TESTED.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES.  INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT CAR WAS OUT OF CENTER AND RIDING THE OUTSIDE OF THE CENTER PLATE BOWL SHIFTING THE WEIGHT OF THE CAR TO ONE SIDE CAUSING THE TRUCKS TO BE RIGID AND NOT ALLOWING THE CAR TO NEGOTIATE THE CURVE IN THE TRACK.  THIS FORCED THE TRUCK TO CLIMB THE RAIL AND DERAIL.
